title: Perseus
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, **Perseus** is the name given to an [historic](/wiki/Historic "Historic") [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") of a [knight](/wiki/Knight_\(player_monster\) "Knight (player monster)") found on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [4.2 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

The statue of Perseus appears in all versions of Medusa's domain, with his location dependent on the version and tied to the down [stairs](/wiki/Stairs "Stairs") location. Two versions of the isle have the statue occupy the same tile as both Medusa and the down stair; the other two have multiple eligible squares for Medusa and the down stair to appear on, and his statue will appear on one of the remaining squares.

The statue of Perseus has an independent chance of containing each of the following items:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

- A 1⁄4 chance of a cursed +0 [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") on the second map, with a 3⁄4 chance on all other maps
- A 3⁄4 chance of a +0 pair of [levitation boots](/wiki/Levitation_boots "Levitation boots") on the second map, with a 1⁄4 chance on all other maps
- A 1⁄2 chance of a blessed +2 [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar")
- A 1⁄2 chance of a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack")

## Strategy

Perseus's statue is often checked for a source of reflection by a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") who either manages to kill Medusa without one, or else plans to pilfer the statue before taking her on - characters should have the required items for at least one of [the usual strategies listed on her article](/wiki/Medusa#Strategy "Medusa") readied and equipped, lest they [end up like Perseus](/wiki/Petrification "Petrification"). His statue can also potentially provide a source of [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"), either for later points of the game such as the [Elemental Planes](/wiki/Elemental_Planes "Elemental Planes") or for crossing Medusa's island freely (e.g. after [digging](/wiki/Digging "Digging") past).

The [raven](/wiki/Raven "Raven")-filled variant of Medusa's island is likely to have the statue on a different island from Medusa herself, making it safer to break the statue but much harder to actually reach either area if the character lacks most other means of crossing the sea.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Perseus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perseus "wikipedia:Perseus")***

Perseus is named for the Greek mythological figure that beheaded and killed [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa"), using his polished shield to view her reflection and avoid meeting her gaze directly. The items found in the statue each reflect the tools Perseus was gifted for the task of killing Medusa: Zeus or Hermes gave him a set of winged sandals and an adamantine *[harpe](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/harpe "wikipedia:harpe")* (a sword with a sickle or scythe in the blade, hence the scimitar); the polished shield was a gift from Athena that would allow him to safely view Medusa; and the Hesperides gave him a knapsack (*kibisis*) with which to safely contain Medusa's head as well. The sack in particular also serves as the inspiration for both the [Wallet of Perseus](/wiki/Wallet_of_Perseus "Wallet of Perseus") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and its variants and the [Bag of the Hesperides](/wiki/Bag_of_the_Hesperides "Bag of the Hesperides") in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack").

## Variants

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), the statue of Perseus is guaranteed to contain the shield of reflection and a pair of levitation boots, with the same independent 1⁄2 chance of the scimitar and sack each generating within the statue.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the +2 scimitar generated within Perseus's statue is replaced by a +2 [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), which additionally has a 1⁄20 chance of being made into an appropriate [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") (i.e. either [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane") or [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir")), with an equal probability for each artifact.

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for Medusa](/wiki/Medusa#Encyclopedia_entry "Medusa").*

In NetHack, Perseus is the name given to an historic statue of a knight found on Medusa's Island.

The statue of Perseus has an independent chance of containing each of the following items:[1][2][3][4]

  • A 1⁄4 chance of a cursed +0 shield of reflection on the second map, with a 3⁄4 chance on all other maps
  • A 3⁄4 chance of a +0 pair of levitation boots on the second map, with a 1⁄4 chance on all other maps
  • A 1⁄2 chance of a blessed +2 scimitar
  • A 1⁄2 chance of a sack

The raven-filled variant of Medusa's island is likely to have the statue on a different island from Medusa herself, making it safer to break the statue but much harder to actually reach either area if the character lacks most other means of crossing the sea.
